entry.title: Waterlooplein station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a 1975 "open tube" event (pictured) at Waterlooplein station gave the citizens of Amsterdam their first look at the city's metro system?

entry.title: annexation to the First Mexican Empire (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Central American government voted for annexation to the First Mexican Empire after a request from Regent Agustín de Iturbide?

entry.title: Craig Greenberg (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Craig Greenberg was shot at while running in the 2022 Louisville mayoral election?

entry.title: Through the Darkest of Times (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Through the Darkest of Times was the first video game published in Germany to use swastikas?

entry.title: Elisabeth Griffith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Elisabeth Griffith's sweeping 100-year history of the American equal-rights movement has been compared to listening to Billy Joel's "We Didn't Start the Fire"?

entry.title: Baeoentedon bouceki (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that although Baeoentedon bouceki was collected from China in 1983, it was not formally described as a new species until 2014?

entry.title: Mary Milligan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Vatican selected Mary Milligan in 1987 to be one of only three U.S. experts to assist the International Synod of Bishops on the Laity in Rome?

entry.title: watch paint drying for ten hours (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a British filmmaker forced the British Board of Film Classification to watch paint drying for ten hours?
